intro: Polygonum punctatum var. leptostachyum, commonly known as the slender-stamen knotweed, is a herbaceous perennial native to parts of East Asia. It features slender, upright stems that are often reddish in color, and its leaves are lance-shaped with a slightly serrated edge. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
